page.title: 04 THE M25 MOTORWAY
page.content: The workmen building the M25 have had many problems including soft sand in which they had to lay 800 piles so they could build on top of it.Several horses have lost their lives in the sand.They have also had to build on boggy land in Gladstone Forest.The sand is called Glaciel and has come from the ice age.The motorway which has gone through many homes has ruined peoples lives.Home Farm are worried that their house might fall into the motorway.The motorway goes down 10m it is 35m across.The sloping banks are 45m down and the bridges are around 15.20 feet above the motorway.The workmen have had to establish a friendly relationship with the people they are taking land from. by N.Runnicles
